sentence.Network_en: He glanced guiltily over his shoulder.
" A dozen times, " repeated Carrie, guiltily.
sentence.Network_cn: “ 十几次,"嘉莉心虚地重复道, “ 不,没有.

sentence.Network_en: " Yes, " he said guiltily; " Mrs. Vance. "
sentence.Network_cn: “ 是的, " 他内疚地说, " 万斯太太来过. ”

entry.def: If you feel guilty, you feel unhappy because you think that you have done something wrong or have failed to do something which you should have done.

example.ex: I feel so guilty, leaving all this to you...
example.tran: 把这些事都留给你去做，我真感到过意不去。

example.ex: When she saw me she looked guilty.

entry.def: Guilty is used of an action or fact that you feel guilty about.

example.ex: Many may be keeping it a guilty secret...
example.tran: 许多人或许保守着这个罪恶的秘密。

example.ex: I leave with a guilty sense of relief.
example.tran: 我带着一种罪恶的解脱感离开。

entry.def: If someone is guilty of a crime or offence, they have committed that crime or offence.

example.ex: They were found guilty of murder...
He pleaded guilty to causing actual bodily harm.
example.tran: 他承认确实犯有人身伤害罪。

entry.def: If someone is guilty of doing something wrong, they have done that thing.

example.ex: He claimed Mr Brooke had been guilty of a 'gross error of judgment'...
example.tran: 他宣称布鲁克先生犯有“判断失误的重大过错”。

example.ex: They will consider whether or not he has been guilty of serious professional misconduct.
example.tran: 他们将考虑他是否犯有玩忽职守的重大过失。

means.word_mean: 1. in the manner of someone who has committed an offense;

auth_sentence.content: Mallon had liked the book, but guiltily.

auth_sentence.content: He was acting guiltily, though he knew there was no reason to, not at the florist's he hadn't done anything yet.
